website_summaries.verdict: While the Canon PowerShot SD870 IS doesn't have an optical viewfinder or manual exposure controls, it captures beautiful images with its wide, 3.8x optical zoom lens and ranks among the top compact cameras we've seen.

customer_reviews.title: Swiss Ski Vacation & the Canon 870IS
customer_reviews.text: This camera was purchased just before a ski trip to the Jungrfrau Region in Switzerland. The camera behaved flawlessly and took over 450 photos and 10 videos without a hitch. The only errors were self inflicted by the photographer. It is wonderful to have such a small camera that takes such awesome and inspiring photos. I kept the camera in a fleece bag while skiing or in my backpack in a camera case. The camera traveled everywhere from Zürich, Thun and Zermatt. I like the size and the ability to take pictures anywhere and at any time. This video was filmed in B/W mode while I was skiing behind my friends. The location was Murren, Switzerland.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Boutelle

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the Canon SD series!
customer_reviews.text: Another great Canon point and shoot. We were hesitant with getting a camera without a viewfinder, since in the past we have liked having them when in high light areas (like at the beach etc) since sometimes its hard to see the screen. This is not the case with the huge, bright, and crisp screen on this camera. It has been bright enough in all situations to not need a view finder. One of our friends had the same fear...and they have been very happy with their sd870 IS. Great battery life so far also! Love the button preview when you lightly touch the touchpad. Good when you don't know what the buttons do. :) Highly recommended camera!
customer_reviews.author: Nick in MN

customer_reviews.title: Best Point and Shoot I've Had Yet
customer_reviews.text: WOW. I just spent a day shooting photos and videos with my new Canon as well as in evening light, and it is completel blowing me away in quality. As with previous PowerShots, it's great in representing photos similarly to how my eye saw the image, the 28mm is rocking, and the video quality is fabulous. I just discovered all kinds of fun special effects for video. Unlike my previous POS, oh I mean P and S, which was a Lumix, this PowerShot lets you zoom while a video is being filmed. That's a great feature. Get a large capacity memory card and this camera, and enjoy taking beautiful professional quality photographs.
customer_reviews.author: Picks n Pans

customer_reviews.title: Canon's Customer Support Is Top Notch
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the SD870 IS over a year ago (11NOV07) and it has performed better than expected. I also own the Canon EOS digital XT but the wife and I needed something compact to carry around. Since then the SD870 has become our primary camera. On a different note, my 2 year-old was playing with SD870 and managed to jam lens. I submitted a repair request through Canon's website [...] and in less than 7 working days after I shipped camera to Canon my camera was back from the repair center in perfect working order. The entire process was simple, from submitting ticket request to checking status of repair online, and all this was done under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Rangel Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have a 970IS now and in almost every way the 870IS was superior. 8MP really is the 'sweet spot' of the 1/3 inch sensors and this one NEVER failed to amaze me. Don't get me wrong, I've taken photographs of things the size of a human hair and smaller with the 970 but I had to "fight for it", with the 870 I once photographed an insect no bigger than a lady bug just by hitting 'macro shot' and you could almost see what it was thinking.
customer_reviews.author: Wyldside

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but still a great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Picked this camera after reading tons of reviews. Main criteria, though, was the large, clear LCD screen. There are lots of setting you can tweak on this, but the main ones I use are the ISO settings. Although this camera has anti-blur, I find that you still need to set the ISO higher manually in many instances to get the best results - that is, without using the flash, which I hate (in all cameras of this type). I wish Canon had done a better job of that. Once you've got the setting you want, it takes great pictures. The menus and settings are easy enough to use (if you know what they all mean).
customer_reviews.author: Grimmy

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera after owning several professional grade Canon's and must admit I wasn't expecting much from a small lightweight model. It has not only surprised me, but exceeded my expectations. Lightweight? Yes. Easy to use? Yes - I didn't look at the instructions until I had the camera for several weeks. OIS works? Yes. Very stable even in a moving vehicle. I took several pictures of the Whitestone Bridge in New York while driving after sunset. The images are clear and the color exquisite. Easy to download and print pictures? It's a snap. Great little model!
customer_reviews.author: Beejay

customer_reviews.title: Satisifed but wished the red eye reduction worked better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera after doing quite a bit of research. I am very impressed with the size of this camera, the face recognition technology and the image stabilization feature. I am a little disappointed with the red eye reduction in this camera. Even with the red eye reduction turned on most images I took on a recent trip had people with red eyes. Now you can fix the red eye using the red eye fixing feature as well which I like. As far as picture quality goes, I am very satisifed with this camera. Battery life is great and the LCD is nice and big.
customer_reviews.author: Abhishek B

customer_reviews.title: What a great camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for the previous model of the same camera (SD850 I believe) that was stolen and what a great camera this is. The wide angle feature is outstanding and the extra zoom compared to a 3x lens is perfect. The quality of the pictures is where Canon stands out, other cameras may have better zoom lenses, but the picture quality falls short. The start up time and the time between pictures is very short and the stabilization is very good. Only one weakness, though not unexpected in a point and shoot, the flash is weak and is not good for any great distances.
customer_reviews.author: H. Carson

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera until the LCD stops working
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for about two years and the ease of use and picture quality are both great. However, the LCD is now a blank white screen, so even though the camera still takes pictures, I can no longer see the pictures on the LCD screen or even see what I am taking a picture of. I also can't use the camera's various settings considering I can no longer see the menu on the screen. I've researched this problem online and it appears to be a problem for other owners of this camera as well. I would not purchase this camera again and I would really hesitate in buying another Canon after having this issue.
customer_reviews.author: EspressO Self

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Received this camera as a birthday present from my family. It took me awhile to get used to using a camera with only an LCD screen, but it's so large (3 in.) and clear, high resolution, that I got the hang of it quickly. The learning curve re: buttons/functions was not steep since I have had Canon cameras before. Took first pictures on a walk along a creek with leave changing and was very pleased with quality. The plastic components (battery cover, etc.) are the only negatives that I've found - covers seem flimsy and likely to break. But I'm very happy with the size, quality of pictures and wide angle lens and good image stabilization function.
customer_reviews.author: Spengle

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, awesome screen
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera - the results are similar to the other Canon's I've used before. The screen is amazing - 3" is much better than 2.5"! I also like the separate button to view the photos I've just taken, as opposed to turning a wheel as many other models do. My only complaint is that it could have more intelligence when using the flash. If you are too close, it will always overexpose. Such a simple thing to fix in the computer chip, too....
customer_reviews.author: Simply Superlative

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: Just like the title says, it is a great little camera. It takes very nice pictures. The large screen is nice compared to my old A85 power shot. I don't miss the view finder, never used it anyway. I am glad I went with this camera with the wide angle lens. It captures alot more. You don't have to keep backing up as far to get everyone into the frame. This camera doesn't fit in the Canon case very good. It is too thick so the cover doesn't close correctly.
customer_reviews.author: K. David

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great price, don't hesitate
customer_reviews.text: As a professional photographer, picking a point and shoot was a tough decision, and after receiving the SD870IS I was not disappointed! It functions great in low-light focusing situations, the color is awesome, the flash is balanced, the screen is huge, and the menus are easy to navigate. You're not going to get professional images out of this camera, so if that's what you're looking for, this isn't the camera for you (check out the Powershot G9 for the most "pro" point & shoot). But if you're looking for something to toss in your bag and take with you everywhere to capture memories as they happen, then this is for sure the camera for you!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff and Erin

customer_reviews.title: Canon SD870 IS
customer_reviews.text: I really like the wide angle lens that this camera has. I would rate higher except that I am concerned that the lens is susceptible to sticking if it gets exposed to sand or grit. My previous SD800 IS died this death a little bit after the 1 year warranty lapsed (and I believe that the warranty did not cover this type of problem anyway). I also like the dedicated button to go to viewing mode. This is a definite improvement over the SD800 IS.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot 870IS
customer_reviews.text: The Canon PowerShot 870IS is my 3rd Canon PowerShot camera within 5 years. It is by far the best Canon camera that I have ever owned. This 8 megapixel camera delivers excellent photos and features for it's small size. After extensive research, I was thoroughly impressed with every feature, including the battery life (1 week on a single charge). The only feature that is missing from this camera (which I do not need anyway) is an optical view finder. The large LCD back screen is the only available view finder for this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Canon SD870 IS Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am very please with the purchase of this camera. Very easy to use, great for getting action shots of the grandkids. Takes excellent scenery photos, crisp, clear and true color. Battery is long lasting, have purchased extra battery to always have another fully charged with me. Used to take pictures of the interior of my home, then used photoshop to change colors on walls, furniture, etc. and wala did my decision making of redecorating with ease. Would recomment this camera to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Geraldene S. Wilfahrt

customer_reviews.title: Nice pictures
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this camera for us after cracking the view screen on our Olympus. I have to say that the pictures are very nice and he had a lot of fun with the video feature on our last backpacking trip. The menus aren't too hard to learn (I figured most of it out during some down time in the tent when it rained). I was able to teach my husband to replay the picures and video with little trouble. Very nice purchase overall.
customer_reviews.author: Packpup

customer_reviews.title: A good purchase, but some inconveniences
customer_reviews.text: The pictures are great for a little camera, which was a replacement to my aging but very good S400. I bought this camera primarily for two reasons: portability and the canon name. For taking pictures, I have no complaints whatsoever. A great little point and shoot. My issues all lie with video capture: don't get me wrong. For a camera whose primary mission in life is to take snapshots and be small, the video quality is fantastic. The file size, however, is tremendously big at 640 resolution. Don't ever think about emailing them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hong

customer_reviews.title: Order was shipped same day and received earlier than projected. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is identical to one I already owned. The zoom lense had stopped retracting all the way on my old camera. I enjoy this camera for traveling and decided to replace it with the same model.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph f Busch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!  Great Transaction!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice when it comes to photography, but I was really impressed with this camera/video recorder when I saw the quality of pictures and video it produced. And just because it's small doesn't mean you can't add to it. I actually made a diffuser out of bubble wrap to fit over the lens, and it's amazing how much more warm and full the pictures are (for up close portraits that is). This camera is compact, yet powerful.
customer_reviews.author: CfromHouston

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I did a LOT of reserch on digital cameras before purchasing the SD870. I started with consumer reports, read all sorts of reviews, and then went to a camera store to get the 'feel' of different ones. I chose this one because it was rated high, has excellent reveiws and had the wide angle lens that I wanted. This is an awesome camera, is easy to use, has great features, has a large LTD screen and takes amazing pictures! You won't be disapointed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING CAMERA!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this camera soooo much!! I was sad when I made the mistake of leaving it at a friend's apartment and came back to it being broken. Takes amazing pictures! I wish that I could find a camera that is newer that takes photos as great as this did!
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Who Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, Fantasic pictures!!
customer_reviews.text: The wide angle aspect of this camera was the first thing that attracted me to this camera. I went to Best Buy and Circuit City to check out this and other cameras and found that this camera was very easy to switch between the different modes and special features of this camera.I couldn't be more happy about my purchase. It's so easy to use, it's small and takes excellent pictures, what more would you want? Buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: K. J. K.

customer_reviews.title: An excellent camera with a tiny limitation
customer_reviews.text: I have found this camera to be excellent in every regard but one. In my previous Canon cameras, I was able to control the aperture and shutter speed manually but this option does not exist on the SD870IS. This is a minor complaint as I rarely used the option in the past. Otherwise, I have really enjoyed this camera. It takes great pictures, it's fast and it's compact size makes it a delight to take anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pics, size, LCD...all you could ask for
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a Nikon Coolpix 2100 for years, ancient by today's standards, however I always thought it took great pics. That was until I saw what this camera can do. WOW! What clarity! And the LCD size is awesome. I never really used my old viewer on my old camera and know I won't miss it on this one. It's a great size, and with the OEM case I bought, it fits great on my belt. Highly recommended camera.
customer_reviews.author: PSU-Temple

customer_reviews.title: Great small easy to use camera
customer_reviews.text: Have used the camera in a variety of settings. The range of setting options provides many opportunities to get those hard to take pictures. For the average user some continual experimenting of settings, flash and speeds will be an on-going effort but the default "Auto" setting is always a good fallback. The wide angle lens and zoom combination give a great range of composition. Size and weight of camera makes it perfect to bring to functions where space is a premium. While 8 MP is nice most pictures can be taken at a lesser MP seting and still be of useful quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dick

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for my broken SD 700 IS
customer_reviews.text: This SD870IS replaces my SD700IS that got a smashed screen from caring it in my pocket. Comparing the two, the 870 has a bigger and brighter screen and the zoom and stabalization work much better. I love these cameras because I can carry them anywhere in a pocket and always get good pictures on the fly. Just two anoyances: Ocashionally the on button is activated while in a pocket. This could damage the cammery if the lens is restricted from extending. When snaping a picture with one hand, ocasionaly my thumb presses another button simotaniosly, causing unintended results.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Solid portable camera - overal best for the money
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera for great battery life and decent pictures. For most of us (amateurs) 8mp should be quite sufficient. Also wide angle on this camera is very nice. The camera easily fits in a pocket and is not a burden when you are traveling. I snap 1000 to 1500 shots on 4gb card without a recharge. You can use this camera in addition to a professional SLR (if you just have to have one).
customer_reviews.author: piverba

customer_reviews.title: Meets or Exceeds Expectations
customer_reviews.text: This camera is at the nexus of portability and image quality. A DSLR would have been fantastic but of course they're quite expensive. saying nothing about their portability. A bridge camera would be a good intermediate step but again, they don't exactly slip into one's pocket. The SD870 is small enough to throw in a pocket (or purse, i'm sure) and takes a quality image. The movie mode has some fun extras (time lapse, color accent) as well. The metal body exudes quality construction and the LCD on the back is nearly gigantic. It's worth the extra money over the SD1000. A fine step before graduating to a bridge camera.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera from Costco first, the lens got stuck in the out position. Returned it and bought another one from Amazon. No problems so far. Takes great pictures, the 3" screen is nice. Image Stabilization works good enough to take good pictures from a moving boat. Not an easy thing to do. Price has come down since it was introduced making it a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: J. K. Shoemaker

customer_reviews.title: I Love the Wide Angle!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because of its wide-angle feature with which I could just point and shoot. I take pictures of decorating that I've done and like the full room shots. I bought a 2 GB card, and with that I can also shoot numerous short movie clips. (We used it to analyze our golf swings on the course. Quite helpful!) The photo quality is great. (This purchase was a move-up from a 5 yr. old Canon 4 MP digital.) The modes and settings are almost intuitive to use. It is compact and a joy to own!
customer_reviews.author: Jerseyjan

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot worked well on vacation
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for a month. Purchased just a few days before vacation. I've taken a lot of photos, but I'm not well educated about cameras. This is pretty straightforward to operate, and provides ample freedom within the automatic settings, and a great deal of flexibility on customized settings. The "macro" mode did very nicely, as did the custom exposure adjustments and the image stabilization. For the price, I've been very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: R. Day

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long enough.
customer_reviews.text: Died after a few years. It wouldn't turn on anymore. Until then it was nice. On the other hand the first Canon point-and-shoot I own, an S100 from 1999, is still ticking. So some models work and some don't. Or quality decreased as time went by.
customer_reviews.author: nsd20463

customer_reviews.title: okay camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera in june 2008 and have been using it since. It has been working pretty well during this period. It fell down a few times but still runs good. The only problem i have is that the picture quality was never quite as crisp as compared to point and shoot cameras from Sony and other companies. The videos are very good though. Battery life is good too.
customer_reviews.author: gjpwiz

customer_reviews.title: Why Canon?
customer_reviews.text: For primarily social situations not requiring long telephoto lens etc. this camera with its large LCD, face detection and image stabilization capabilities is almost ideal for non-professionals and then with the added wide angle lens well that does make it ideal for group pictures and casual on the go shots. The size makes it a handy carry around point shoot that doesn't intrude into the picture composition like some other "larger" point shoot cameras. Menu selections are easy to understand and playback review a separate button. Great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Gary G. Lai

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my very first digital camera and it took me years to pick one. I've used friend's cameras and find that Canons seem to take better pictures. I'm very happy with my decision. The camera is very user-friendly so it wasn't too intimidating. Taking group picture is a breeze with the wide angle lens. Action shots comes out clear and not blurry (at the right setting) and night shots are amazing. The movie function is nice but don't expect it to give you quality like a real digi-camcorder. All-in-all a very nice point & shoot.
customer_reviews.author: sportsnut_ed

customer_reviews.title: amazing camera
customer_reviews.text: i cant say enough good things about this camera. it takes AMAZING pictures... the quality is top notch and the colors are so vivid. it takes great perfect stills despite my fast-moving baby. its easy to operate. it is well worth the money. i researched a lot of cameras before deciding on this one after talking to a professional photographer who uses this for everyday use. it was definitely the right decision!
customer_reviews.author: M. Matt

customer_reviews.title: best camera ever
customer_reviews.text: takes crystal clear pictures and videos. can zoom in pretty far. works in various lighting conditions. Lots of optional settings. I haven't learned how to used them all yet, but it's easy enough for me and my kids to use in auto mode.
customer_reviews.author: Laundry Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love Canon cameras. In addition to this one, I also own the very similar Canon PowerShot SD630. However, this updated version has a better lens, higher megapixels, and, most importantly, image stabilization. It's slightly thicker than my SD630, but just as easy to hold and to operate, maybe even easier. As with most cameras of this type with large screens, there is no viewfinder but I haven't found this to be a problem. This has to be one of the best compact cameras on the market.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have a Canon SD870, I see a black dot on the LCD, almost half inch, when I turn the camera off, I can still see the spot, although it's now lighter than the dark LCD. So this appears to be a physical defect of some kind, not electronic. There are a few horizontal rows of pixels below the larger spot. they are grayish in color and semi translucent with small patches of pink and green ones around its edges.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed this camera so far. The menus are easy to navigate and the choice of camera settings is quite large (almost too large). The pictures are great even though I have no photography skills. The camera is light but feels quite durable. The view screen is big and has great clarity. I like everything about it. The lense became stuck half in and half out when powering down at one point. Must have been defective. [...] has been great and they replaced it free of charge. The camera has been going strong ever since. I love taking pictures with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Oneill

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: The Canon PowerShot series is definitely the best mini camera series available in the market. I bought the SD870 for my sister, and I have the SD850 myself. When it comes to taking landscape photos, the SD870 is better due to the wide screen, but I definitely prefer the micro shots of the SD850. So I would pick either the SD850 or the SD870 (I tried many others!! They are the best!) according to what the type of photos you take more often.... Both are excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Y. Hadad

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Have had intermittent problems with the lens sticking but it keeps working so with any good fortune it will continue to do so.
customer_reviews.author: imfelinelucky

customer_reviews.title: Still one of the best point & shoot cameras out there!
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 of these, and due to the volume of pictures and conditions, it has been the best performing camera for field work I've ever used...goes anywhere, it's light, and operating the settings for optimimal images is quick and easy...
customer_reviews.author: LV Consultant

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera a few months ago and have used it in a variety of settings. I don't have any complaints about this camera at all. I've had others to admire my camera as well. This was my first digital camera and I am glad that I made this my camera of choice. The video is clear and the pictures are too. Oh! The pictures are so clear and crisp; it really takes nice pictures. I also love the fact that I don't have to buy batteries over and over..it comes with a rechargeable battery. I highly recommend this camera!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lakeisha Walker

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD87OIS
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! It is so easy to use and so small it fits in a pocket. My previous digital camera was too complicated. This manual is very user friendly (for someone who is a beginner) and if you want to do more advanced stuff, the manual explains step by step. This is a great camera with a fabulous price. The pictures are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia D. Keenan

customer_reviews.title: Rugged
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera nearly 4 yrs and i toss it in my bike messenger bag most of the time. It's beat up but still going good. Sometimes the power button gets hit while in my pocket and it causes the camera to open up in my pocket, this has damaged the mechanism (canon replaced free of charge). Very rugged, great wide angle featues and also time-lapse video is fun for home remodeling.
customer_reviews.author: SuperDave

customer_reviews.title: Early results are fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love this camera. It is small enough to fit in my pocket, but not too small that I can't "feel" it when I hold it. The picture quality is teriffic. The movie quality is great, too -- very smooth. If I had to find a fault, it would be that the the battery strength indicator doesn't give you a good feel for how long you have left. The Sony camera this replaces did a better job of this. Other than that, I'm EXTREMELY satisfied -- one week into ownership.
customer_reviews.author: RLD3

customer_reviews.title: Cannon PowerShot SD870IS
customer_reviews.text: Had it for many years and took many travel and family pictures with it. I is easy to use and portable. Love it. Have not seen any new camera with improvement that is satisfactory to me so far. Will continue to use it till it dies.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lai

customer_reviews.title: My online business depend to this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I tried all cheap and expensive cameras but find this one is the great with the white balance. My first camera quit after 6 years and whenever I found a good used one I just buy it since this camera discontinue.
customer_reviews.author: Nakpunar

customer_reviews.title: I just love this cam
customer_reviews.text: I had an older Canon SD-500 and enjoyed it. It was time for a upgrade I did my usual research and bought the SD-870IS. I just love this camera. Wow! I wouldn't trade it for anything. It's just perfect. The video quality is unbelievable even with low light. If you want a good point and shoot look no further!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Viranga

customer_reviews.title: So far, excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as gift for wife and right off the bat she was taking pictures. For her it's important to be easy to use. The pics are really good and it seems to do a fair job in lesser light photography. The battery lasted fairly long although I will be buying a backup just for ease since she's not to quick to remember to charge it when it's low or out. I would replace with the same camera again if I had to since I tried two others first that were more expensive and didn't fit our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Arbeez

customer_reviews.title: canon sd870is
customer_reviews.text: we were heading to Hungary and I didn't want to take my new d300 so i went online for some advise. This is a great little camera. If you buy one, play with the manual settings as it takes a little practice, but this camera now replaced my d70 as my go to camera for daily usage. good job.
customer_reviews.author: Russell E. Luke III

customer_reviews.title: Canon Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: Canon PowerShot SD870IS SMP Digital Camera with 3.Sx Wide Angle Optical is one great little camera. The Canon PowerShot takes great pictures and also video. It is very easy to use and I would purchase again if I needed a camera.
customer_reviews.author: Larry R Goodeill Sr

customer_reviews.title: great so far
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. I did a lot of research before I bought this camera and so far I'm pleased. I really like the wide angle lens, large LCD screen,rechargable lithium ion battery and the color swap option. My only complaint is that the image on the screen looks grainy but the pictures are clear
customer_reviews.author: Claire V

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Canon Camera
customer_reviews.text: I had the 800IS and upgraded to this mostly for the added megapixel since I use this for professional pics in the OR. It has a WIDE angle lens for a compact camera. Color is great. I have used pictures from this camera in publications. Although there is no comparison at many levels between this and my Canon 1D MarkII, the final picture is just as good if your technique is right. the screen is BIG on this unit. Less room for controls, though.
customer_reviews.author: Pierce D. Nunley MD

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: The Canon PowerShot SD870IS is everything, and more, that I expected. I especially like the simplicity of the menu selections and the wide-angle feature. Any difficulty I've had with the camera have been "operator error." With any device, take the time to read and understand the instruction.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the sd870!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I originally bought the sd850, and while it's pretty good, I wasn't happy with it. The 870 has everything the 850 was missing--a low battery icon, even easier use, slightly better photos, a wide angle lens, and it's sturdier. The little flap you lift to connect the USB cable seems much sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: lng

customer_reviews.title: Love the wide angle!
customer_reviews.text: I was a professional photographer in a former life and I must say that this camera fits my bill for small and powerful. The wide angle is great for panoramic as well as excellent full framed close up portraits! I love the slow synchro too, makes for great indoor and night shots with the flash. I only wish I could find a screen protector because im in the desert and afraid its going to get scratched.
customer_reviews.author: A guy who buys stuff

customer_reviews.title: Wide Angle
customer_reviews.text: I am a total amateur and had never owned a point and shoot before. I read a lot of reviews before buying this camera in August 2008. I could not understand why the wide angle would be helpful to me, but trusted that everyone knew what they were talking about. Bought it, used it and liked everything. Then, at work, I used a cheaper point at shoot without a wide angle lens. it was frustrating trying to get everything in the photo without being too far away from the subject. The wide angle is indespensible. Can't recommend this camera enough.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Picture Perfect !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as a pre-birthday gift for myself to replace my Canon SD 550 camera and I love it ! The LCD screen in the back is phenomenal which make my picture taking a breeze. I love the 18 different screen shot options they have and the images I took with my camera are sharp and right on ! I would definitely recommend this camera !
customer_reviews.author: Nikarue

customer_reviews.title: you gotta love Canon !
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Canon I am purchasing. I travel a lot, so needed a camera that would fit in my pant pockets and still provide good quality pics and this model won hands down ! Since then I have bought 2 more of these for others and everyone is happy with it. Battery life goes down considerably after 2 years but a spare battery is all you need when you travel.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gopal

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a big can of Canon. We bought this camera to replace our SD450. We are really happy with it. Display is huge. We wanted a larger display rather than a viewfinder that we would never use. Camera is very attractive. If you have owned a Canon before, the menus should be familiar. The only big difference is that to use special scenes you have to actually change it at the top of the camera(switch) rather than through the menus. Great camera. Great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene C. Trapp

customer_reviews.title: Great camera; GREAT seller!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was an exact model replacement camera for a friend. I had sent hers to the Canon factory for repair, but they planned to substitute another camera for hers. She was adamant that she only wanted her camera or the same model because she especially liked the features. This camera filled the bill, and it works perfectly. As advertised there were a couple small scratches on the body, but it looked new otherwise, AND the seller had it to me in TWO DAYS after I ordered it. My friend is happy and so am I.
customer_reviews.author: Phredd

customer_reviews.title: what a wide angle!
customer_reviews.text: I changed my canon powershot A40 for this SD870IS. The design is beautiful, small, light, (no smallest, no ligthest). The angle of the lens is simply spectacular: in the family picture, everybody fit; camping, the trees fit, is amazing. The screen is nice. Quality of pictures is excellent (canon). There is no room for the right thumb when you take a picture, that means is a little tricky to take a picture handeling the camera just with one hand, but this does not bother me. I would recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No brainer !
customer_reviews.text: On of the best cameras I have ever had !
customer_reviews.author: P.C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera, User Guide somewhat difficult.
customer_reviews.text: My PowerShot SD870 IS is an excellent camera and performs exactly as advertized. Once set up, you almost never have to change settings as the Auto function performs so well. I have not noticed any difference between using the Auto setting or specific shooting modes of which there are ten available. I did find the User Guide took some getting used to, maybe because there are so many options. I would highly recommend this camera. JBMCC, STUART, FL
customer_reviews.author: J. B. MCCRUDDEN

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a great segway for people looking to get more experience in photography, without taking the plunge just yet into SLR's. I highly recommend it to anyone who's looking for a digital camera that does more than just "meet their needs"!
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera with all the bells and whistles!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is both quite simple and adequately complex at the same time. I can use it easily as a great point-and-shoot and love the pics but also learn something new every week that it can do. The sky seems to be the limit with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Salmon

customer_reviews.title: Canon
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about this purchase... The best used camera I ever purchased. Look brand New and works the same.
customer_reviews.author: James Stiefel

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have no complains after using it for over 1 month. The picture quality is pretty good. Compare to SD850IS, this one is better looking too :) especially the Black option. The small lid which covers the usb slot looks fragile. I feel that my 2 yr old will easily break it if he gets hold of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ghayur

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: This is an older-model of the Canon PowerShot. I'd bought this model new some years ago and always liked the photos I took with it. When it stopped working, it wasn't the right time for me to buy something different -- because of the price, the research required to find something I'd like as much, and the learning curve -- so I bought the same model new at a reasonable price. This is exactly what I wanted and in better shape that the one I had -- before I dropped it!
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle Kaskowitz

customer_reviews.title: Great camera in any light!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many brands of cameras: Kodak, Fuji, Sony....This camera beats all of them hands down. The battery life is phenomenal, the pictures in light and dark come out very clear with little digital noise, there is easy access to manual controls, face detection and image stabilization work wonderfully, easy to work and figure out....I'm still discovering all of the features. I would definately recommend to a novice and to an experienced shutter bug!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay F. Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Good camera and service
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera, I did a lot of research and found this to be the best camera for the money. Takes great pictures and very good quality video. I was wanting a camera to take good video as well as great pictures. I am very pleased with this camera. When I got the camera it had a line of dead pixels on the viewing screen. I told Amazon about it and had a new camera in about 4 to 5 days. They paid for all the shipping also. I am very pleased with the service I recieved.
customer_reviews.author: David Young

customer_reviews.title: 6 Year old easy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. It is really easy to use. I have 6 year old twins and they can zoom and shoot with this one. It is also very durable I have dropped it more than the kids and it doesn't have a scratch. It will also give you some great advanced settings if you are the advanced user. I had another Canon before this one and would highly recommend Canon Products and Amazon.com. I think this is the best camera for quality, features and price right now. Hope this helps!!
customer_reviews.author: William Gross

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD870IS
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, quick and sharp little point and shoot. The LCD screen is large and clear. The camera has lots of interesting features like face recognition courtesy of the Digic processor. The focus and shutter is quick and it offers a fair amount of manual control for those who like to play.
customer_reviews.author: mkoz

customer_reviews.title: Just Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I got the camera as a joint Christmas present. Our Grandkids visited us at Christmeas and we were snapping pictures right along. Very easy to use, we made a 25 sec video the first day. Pictures were of excellent quality. We chose the 5MB very fine format. The large 3" video monitor is just about perfect. We would lighly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD870IS
customer_reviews.text: Great point and shoot camera. I also considered the SD850IS but choose the 870 for the wider angle lens. The wide angle lens is great for family and friends pictures. Do not miss the viewfinder yet but I have not used the camera outside in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: jcmiller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: It is simple to operate and take excellent pictures. The screen without fingure print affected is very cool. Menu is easy to navigate. UBS port cover design is flimsy and could be done better. Overall, it is a good camera
customer_reviews.author: Got Book!

customer_reviews.title: Not too good with flash
customer_reviews.text: Mostly fine except for the flash. The reaction time for the flash is slow. It took the picture more than a sec after I press the button. Also, the lighting (color) of the pictures is not that good when using flash.
customer_reviews.author: W. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Beauty of a camera
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with this little beauty of a camera. It's features are copious. I'll never learn them all. The size is perfect for travel. It has made my larger Sony obsolete by its sheer size. And I really like the larger LCD screen.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Durable Produce and Decent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this camera for 3 year. The battery still can last all day long, but of course I didn't use flash quite often. The picture quality is pretty good for a point-and-shot compact design. The display can automatically rotate as you rotate the camera. I found this feature very handy.
customer_reviews.author: JQ

customer_reviews.title: Works Good
customer_reviews.text: This is my second SD870IS. The auto focus broke on the first one. I am hoping that this one lasts 7 years like the previous one.
customer_reviews.author: Dun Runnin

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera For Outdoors, Bad for Indoors/Flash
customer_reviews.text: Its a good camera overall (I like Canon products). It takes the best pictures outdoors in sunlight or indoors in very bright lights. With Flash the pics are grainy and poor quality. Wish for this price Canon would include bigger SD card and extra battery.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain hunter

customer_reviews.title: Oustanding
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT for my needs at a perfect price. Bought this model for its great Time-Lapse video feature.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Isaac Jr.

customer_reviews.title: So very Happy
customer_reviews.text: This camera is everything I expected and more. Great camera for the price. I love the screen size and the pictures. Wish the battery level indicator stayed on all the time but other than that it's great. Amazon has never failed me.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Minshall

customer_reviews.title: Canon SD870IS review
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice camera. Pictures taken in the daylight look excellent. Still have some problems with pictures taken in the dark (with the flash), but I have read some reviews about tuning the ISO to fix this. Apart from that the product is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Wandera

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: I use the Canon Powershot SD870IS for work and have found it to be excellent and easy to use. The controls are most intuitive and I rarely get an out of focus shot. Changing settings seems particularily easy. A co-worker has the SD800IS which works great as well. I found the large display versus the view finder to be worth it. The best feature is the wide angle lens. If you have even low light conditions, you won't need a flash and yet the pictures (on a computer screen at least) aren't grainy. Battery lasts a long time. Get the canon elph leather camera case. It protects nicely yet keeps the camera compact.
customer_reviews.author: wackysilver44

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera. I love the point and shoot, and easy to fit in the pocket type cameras. I had the SD500 since it first came out about 2.5 yrs ago. Loved it, but the SD870IS is definitely a step forward. I love the Image stabilization. Even my wife can shoot good pictures. Very easy to learn and use.
customer_reviews.author: Remital

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera
customer_reviews.text: Like many of the other camera's in the ELPH line, the 870 has a nice feel and good pictures that come out of it. I don't miss the viewfinder at all. The camera has been on it's first charge for weeks and hundreds of photos now. The wide angle is nice, there is a level of graininess in the photos that I would have expected to be slightly less, but for the level of camera that it is, it's totally acceptable to me.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Seller recommended
customer_reviews.text: Merchandise arrived promptly in advertised condition (used). The line in the screen flaw was mentioned. Didn't expect it to be as prominent. Price was competitive. Seller is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dick

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: Has more than what you would expect from a point and shoot camera. Photos have been rewarding. I happen to loose the charger at the airport, the replacement charger is quite expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Agrawal

customer_reviews.title: excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended. Excellent camera. If you're looking for a small, well made 8MP with all the bells and whistles, plus wide angle - this is it. Great price and very fast handling by Amazon (as usual).
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kurlander

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures
customer_reviews.text: I've done so much research before purchasing this camera. This camera is easy to use, and the pictures are great. Cannon certainly lives up to its reputation with this camera. I love the wide angle feature when you have alot of people that need to be included. The video works very well also. For a portable video, the sound is okay, but much better than other point/shot degitial around my house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: This camera is extremely easy to operate, is easy to understand, and the large screen really helps. A great point and shoot camera. I didn't realize until I got the camera that it is also capable of video as well as still images. The video is easy to operate and has good image quality. This is a replacement for a Canon Power Shot S50 that was about four years old and is much better. I really like all the improvements and know I will enjoy this camera for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy R. Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera!
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera, it replaced a Sony Cybershot and it's completely lived up to my expectations. I'm certainly nothing more than a casual user, typically I use it for real estate photos so the wide-angle and image stabilization have been handy. I imagine they'd be helpful to just about anyone who's the same as I am ... someone who doesn't need lots of bells and whistles. I've been very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Nice POS but Poor Lens
customer_reviews.text: As a first time Canon owner I was pleased by the picture quality of the 870IS. It does everything I wanted a POS to do... except one small thing. This camera has broken on me twice in the span of 6 months with the same problems (lens error). After a while, the lens will not retract when turning off and then the auto-focus is permanently blurry.
customer_reviews.author: V. Pham

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Beautiful pictures----excellent colour, clarity and no fuzzyness when taking pics (which was a problem with both of my other cameras). Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD870IS Camera
customer_reviews.text: In my experience, the Canon PowerShot SD870IS is an excellent point and shoot digital camera. I have used one since 2008 without any problems. If it is handled carefully and kept in a protective case,it should last a long time. As with any digital camera, the LCD can be damaged if dropped or mishandled. It performs equally well in bright sunshine and indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SD870IS 8MP Digital Camera with 3.8x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Silver)
product_meta.description:
Color:SilverFrom the very first glance, the smooth shape and bold lines of the stylish PowerShot SD870IS Digital ELPH signal that this is no ordinary camera. With 8.0 megapixels of resolution, an Optical Image Stabilizer, and 3.8x optical zooming, the SD870IS Digital ELPH boasts impressive specs as well as a host of convenience features. Face Detection Technology for worry-free people shots. A large 3.0-inch LCD to give you a perfect view of your scene. The Auto ISO Shift and ISO 1600 deliver brilliant images in challenging lighting.

AMAZON.COM


 From the very first glance, the smooth shape and bold lines of the stylish PowerShot SD870IS Digital ELPH signal that this is no ordinary camera. With 8.0 megapixels of resolution, an Optical Image Stabilizer, and 3.8x optical zooming, the SD870IS Digital ELPH boasts impressive specs as well as a host of convenience features. Face Detection Technology for worry-free people shots. A large 3.0-inch LCD to give you a perfect view of your scene. The Auto ISO Shift and ISO 1600 deliver brilliant images in challenging lighting. 

PowerShot SD870IS Highlights 



3.8x optical zoom in action Stylish dual-tone 8.0-megapixel Digital ELPH in two elegant colors You deserve a camera as individual as you are. That's why the PowerShot SD870IS Digital ELPH is available in a choice of two head-turning models. Select from your choice of the impressive matte black or the sophisticated chrome silver front-ring design. Both feature a gleaming metallic body whose smooth, simple shape is handsomely contrasted with bold side lines. In addition, both also offer 8.0 megapixels of resolution so you get images with the high-degree of detail and richness of color that enables you to print, crop, and enlarge for maximum self-expression. 

3.8x wide-angle zoom lens to get more family and friends into one perfect photo With a wide-angle 3.8x optical zoom lens equipped with Canon's advanced Optical Image Stabilizer Technology, you've got what it takes to capture astonishing, lavishly detailed close-ups with total confidence. Now you don't even have to worry about camera shake getting in the way of perfect pictures. Because even at maximum telephoto, the SD870IS Digital ELPH keeps you rock steady. So you can create images that are sharp, clear, and bright--just like you want them to be. You'll amaze yourself and others with what you can achieve with the SD870IS Digital ELPH. 

Large high-quality 3.0-inch PureColor LCD screen with wide viewing angle The camera's 3.0-inch LCD screen gives you the big picture, whether you're shooting, reviewing, or showing off your images. This extra-durable, high-resolution screen with tough scratch-resistant coating on the anti-reflective, PureColor LCD screen offers a crisp, clear picture to make shooting, playback, and using the camera's menu functions especially convenient. Clear and bright, it also features Night Display for easy viewing in low light. 

Canon technology maximizes quality and performance Genuine Canon Face Detection Technology sets the focus, exposure, and flash automatically, leaving you free to compose a group, capture an unguarded moment, or coax the perfect smile. 

Find multiple faces with Canon's improved Face Detection technology DIGIC III features Face Detection technologies, giving the you best possible results in any shooting situation. Face Detection AF/AE sets the focus point and exposure for the faces of your subjects. Face Detection FE adjusts the flash to correctly illuminate your subject to provide the best balance between your subject and the overall scene, eliminating the common problems of over- and underexposed faces. 

With DIGIC III, your images boast superior quality, the camera operates at top efficiency and battery life is enhanced. What's more, DIGIC III enables Canon's Face Detection Technology and Red-eye Correction to give you better, more true-to-life people shots. Simply press the Shutter Button halfway down, and the camera automatically pinpoints the faces in the scene and chooses the ideal focus point. The camera controls exposure settings and flash to keep every face looking bright and natural. Red eyes can be corrected during playback. 

iSAPS Technology is an entirely original scene-recognition technology developed for digital cameras by Canon. Using an internal database of thousands of different photos, iSAPS works with the fast DIGIC III Image Processor to improve focus speed and accuracy, as well as exposure and white balance. 

Red-eye correction detects and corrects red-eye during playback. In unusual cases where red-eye is not automatically detected, it can easily be corrected manually during playback mode. 

The PowerShot SD870IS Digital ELPH features ISO 1600 and High ISO Auto settings that reduce the effects of camera shake and sharpen subjects in low-light situations, giving you greater shooting flexibility. 

17 Shooting Modes, Including 10 Special Scene Modes Advanced presets for the best possible photos under certain conditions. 

The Complete Print Solution 

Print/Share Button for easy direct printing and downloading, plus ID Photo Print and Movie Print with select PIXMA Photo Printers, CP, and SELPHY Compact Photo Printers. 

The PowerShot SD870IS Digital ELPH's Print/Share button makes direct printing easier than ever. Simply connect the SD870IS Digital ELPH to a Canon CP, SELPHY, or PIXMA Photo Printer or any PictBridge compatible photo printer, press the lighted Print/Share button, and print! Also use the Print/Share button to transfer images to a computer (Windows and Macintosh). 

Print your own ID photos in 28 different sizes or use the Movie Print function to output multiple stills from a recorded movie on a single sheet with a Canon SELPHY Compact Photo Printer. 

What's in the box: 

PowerShot SD870IS Digital ELPH digital camera, lithium battery pack NB-5L, battery charger CB-2LX, 32MB SD memory card SDC-32M, wrist strap WS-DC2, Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM, USB interface cable IFC-400PCU, AV cable AVC-DC300

17 shooting modes, including 10 special scene modes; Print/Share button
